poem:
"Revelations in Rice"

Simple parcels of taste undress,
In pan's hot theatre, transient mess,
Prawns pirouette with pak choi grace,
In the culinary ballroom's rosy face.
Kimchi, that ruffled, spicy frock,
Fire dances on the plain rice block.
Pea-green confetti tossed in mirth,
Indian innovation births new birth.
Done in the muffled microwave hum,
An echoed chant, "Supper's done!"
